title: New free champion rotation: Jinx, Thresh, Vi and more!

replies.body: I wanted to have a top comment; but I can't think of anything clever to write. So just pretend I said something hilarious and upvote me anyway :). *"The unseen joke is the funniest"* - {{champion:238}}
*"The foreseen joke is the funniest"* -{{champion:90}}
{{champion:57}} I am Groot.
{{champion:57}} We are Groot

{{champion:26}} I concur.
I am a rock. {{champion:54}}
Now that its top comment, is it still funny, because everyone can see it?
I just bought {{champion:222}} and {{champion:254}} ... and they are free {{item:3070}} {{item:2049}}
This means you can make noobish mistakes and just have everyone assume it's because it's free week.
Considering he just went 2-9-3 on Vi, yes. We'll just assume it's free week.
This guys is a Genious.{{champion:74}}
I literally own All except Jinx... Lol
Oh I thought you figuratively owned all except Jinx.
Webster's modified the definition of "literally" to include "figuratively" so he could have already said that....
Its so dumb, I heard of it too. Such as "It literally scared the crap out of me" RIP English
english has been dead for a long time
Thats idiotic. Modifying a word simply because people are too stupid to understand it?
ummm, oxford english dictionary has made conversate a word because people were too stupid to use the word converse...

You must be joking, right? Languages continuously go through what are called "cultural shifts." If you went back to 1700 you wouldn't recognize English because it was drastically different than it is today. Colloquialisms such as "It literally scared the crap out of me" become so commonplace that they become an accepted part of the language. Furthermore, if you plan on calling people stupid, try adding an apostrophe to that contraction. It would be "that's" not "thats."
